wordpressPost.title: Cross-platform scripting using bash
wordpressPost.content:
Introduction

When you sit down and write a bash script and it works on your machine, you wrap up your work and call it a day.

Now suppose that you have to write a cross-platform bash script that will run on any target machine running either Windows, Linux, or MacOS. You have another cup of coffee. It’s going to be a long night.

Don’t worry, there is hope. This book will take you on a journey covering all there is to know about cross-platform scripting using bash.

Cross-platform scripting is not hard if you have the required background knowledge of tools and utilities available on target hosts.

Terms

Operating system

Software governing a machine, also known as Windows, Linux, or MacOS

Machine

Computing hardware with operating system installed

Dev machine

Your machine running one or more of the operating systems

Target machine

Any machine running any operating system
